julie.text: Billie Holiday is known for pouring her heart and soul into every note, but this rendition of "All of Me" seems to me the most vulnerable and bare. Those opening lines - All of me / Why not take all of me? Can't you see... It's as if she's offering herself completely on a platter.

The Ink Spots are here now singing Address Unknown. This one just hits me right in the feels, you know? Those opening lines - it sounds so heart-wrenchingly sincere when they sing about there being no trace of their loved one and how much he yearns to see that person's face again after staying away too long... wow!
Now it's Ol' Blue Eyes himself, Frank Sinatra, crooning about that elusive blue moon. I wonder if he ever found what his lonely heart was yearning for... Here's "Blue Moon".

julie.song: Billie Holiday - God Bless the Child
julie.text: Billie Holiday is up next, and her haunting voice makes this rendition of God Bless the Child just wrench your heart. What can we infer about a child who's been rejected by their own mother? Billie puts those poignant lyrics into perspective like no one else could...

julie.song: Louis Armstrong - A Kiss to Build a Dream On
julie.text: Well, folks, Louis Armstrong is up next singing A Kiss to Build a Dream On. I wonder if anyone else has ever found themselves dreaming big after just one tender moment with someone special? He's got that dreamy tone going on here too - you can almost hear the sparkle in his eye as he croons about sweet nothings and imagination running wild!

julie.song: Dean Martin - Everybody Loves Somebody Sometimes
julie.text: Now here comes Dean Martin, sounding as smooth and charming as ever in Everybody Loves Somebody Sometimes. That catchy chorus seems to capture a universal truth - love finds us when we least expect it!
It sounds to me, Peggy Lee has captured that simmering passion in "Fever", asking us how deep her feelings run when embraced by a loved one. What's your take on the song's sultry heat?

julie.song: Bing Crosby - Dear Hearts And Gentle People
julie.text:
Bing Crosby is synonymous with warmth and comfort, isn't he? Here comes one of his most soothing voices on Dear Hearts And Gentle People. I wonder if it's just me imagining this song as a soundtrack to some idyllic Sunday afternoon family gathering in a simpler time... 

(Starts playing the Bing Crosby recording)

Fats Waller is here to lift my spirits, as he often does. In the midst of feeling lonely and content just being by myself - that ache for companionship balanced with embracing solitude's quiet happiness... Fats sings it so eloquently in Ain't Misbehavin'. Now let him serenade us!

julie.song: Bob Wills - Bubbles In My Beer
julie.text: Bob Wills is singing Bubbles in My Beer, and I wonder if he was having a bit of fun teasing the folks at home about their Sunday afternoon beverages. With his signature western swing style, Bob always keeps things lively!

mr_new_vegas.text: The one and only Billie Holiday, her smooth vocals a balm for the soul. Let me ask you New Vegas listeners - what does it take to surrender completely? To give your all without reserve... Here's Lady Day crooning 'All of Me', as if whispering secrets directly into each lonely heart tuned in tonight from The Strip and beyond.

The one and only Ink Spots bring us a timeless tale of longing, their smooth harmonies weaving together in "Address Unknown". What would you give to see the face again of someone who's been absent from your life for far too long? This next song is for all those yearning hearts out there.

Good evening, darlings. I have for you now a timeless lament from Ol' Blue Eyes himself, Frank Sinatra - the bittersweet tale of longing and solitude in "Blue Moon". The ache in his voice as he croons about standing alone without love is simply heart-wrenching... almost like listening to your own darkest thoughts on a lonely night. But that's what makes this tune so poignant; it speaks straight into our souls, reminding us all we're not truly isolated until the one who understands has forsaken you - and even then, there remains always hope for renewal under a "blue moon".

mr_new_vegas.song: Billie Holiday - God Bless the Child
mr_new_vegas.text: The inimitable Billie Holiday is up next, and her soulful voice will move you as it does every time she sings. In "God Bless the Child," Lady Day pours out a poignant plea for divine mercy on those struggling with hardship - can't help but wonder how many hearts this song has touched over its decades-long life?

mr_new_vegas.song: Louis Armstrong - A Kiss to Build a Dream On
mr_new_vegas.text: Louis Armstrong is bringing us an intimate ballad tonight, a tender plea for the spark of romance to set one's imagination ablaze. "A Kiss to Build a Dream On," he croons with that unmistakable gravelly tone - can you feel it? That yearning in his voice as he asks simply: Give me a kiss...

mr_new_vegas.song: Dean Martin - Everybody Loves Somebody Sometimes
mr_new_vegas.text: "Ladies and gentlemen, I think it safe to say that Dean Martin has never sounded more suave than on this next number. With his smooth croon leading the way, he'll take you by the hand through a romantic journey of love found in unexpected places - 'Everybody Loves Somebody Sometimes' is ready for its close-up."

Peggy Lee, her sultry voice dripping with desire as she croons of an all-consuming passion in this 1958 standard. Can it be that love can truly make one feel like they're burning up from the inside out? "Fever" indeed! 

[Song starts]

mr_new_vegas.song: Bing Crosby - Dear Hearts And Gentle People
mr_new_vegas.text: Ladies and gentlemen, it is my pleasure to play for you tonight this beautiful gospel-inspired song by the one-and-only Bing Crosby. As those tender lyrics wash over us - "Dear hearts and gentle people" - I find myself reflecting on all that brings peace in a world turned upside down out here in New Vegas. This next tune helps me remember there's still so much to be grateful for, like each of you listening right now...

Listen up, New Vegas! Here comes Fats Waller with the unapologetically carefree spirit of "Ain't Misbehavin'". Who can resist this infectious groove when life has you feeling perfectly content on your own? That's what I call happiness - no one to talk or walk alongside yet still having a blast, all by yourself!

mr_new_vegas.song: Bob Wills - Bubbles In My Beer
mr_new_vegas.text: New Vegas, Bob Wills is known for his Texas swing and western jazz tunes that capture the carefree spirit of a night out on the town. So let's pour ourselves some Bubbles In My Beer as we sip away our worries under those neon lights shining bright! This next song goes out from me to you - all my beautiful listeners tuning in tonight, reminding us there ain't nothing like good company and an ice-cold beer when times get tough on the wasteland.
